• It is crucial that the network perimeter is secure.

  • Secure administrative access must be implemented on infrastructure devices.

  • For remote access to infrastructure devices, implement advanced virtual login security.

  • Use SSH instead of Telnet wherever supported.

Security Operator Privileges
  • Configure AAA
  • Issue show Commands
  • Configure Firewall
  • Configure IDS/IPS
  • Configure NetFlow

WAN Engineer Privileges
  • Configure Routing
  • Configure Interfaces
  • Issue show Commands

• Provide access to infrastructure devices based on privilege level.

  • Implement role-based CLI to provide hierarchical administrative access.

• Secure Cisco IOS images and configuration files using the Cisco IOS resilient configuration feature.

  • Identify factors for securely transmitting data related to network management and reporting of device activity.

  • Implement syslog logging from critical infrastructure devices.

  • Implement SNMP management reporting.

  • Configure a central time source using the Network Time Protocol (NTP).

• Identify all services, interfaces, and management services that are vulnerable to network attacks.

  • Routinely perform security audits.

  • Use the SDM one-step lockdown feature or the auto secure command on new routers.
